alert.note: Alert for Canon City Vicinity, Eastern Fremont County; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft; Wet Mountains between 6300 and 10000Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:34PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...High based showers and thunderstorms will impact portions of central Fremont County through 315 PM MDT... At 233 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking gusty wind producing thunderstorms 8 miles northwest of Royal Gorge, or 26 miles northeast of Hayden Pass Burn Scar, moving south at 15 mph. Other thunderstorms were developing across northwest Fremont county, also moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Local wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northern Hayden Pass Burn Scar, Texas Creek, Royal Gorge, Howard, Coaldale, Waugh Mountain, Cotopaxi and Canon City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
